titleInfo.title: COLON v. ROZUM et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MAGISTRATE THOMAS J. RUETER'S REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION THAT THE PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS BE DISMISSED AS TIME-BARRED AND THAT NO CERTIFICATE OF APPEALABILITY BE GRANTED. THE PETITIONER MAY FILE OBJECTIONS TO THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION. OBJECTIONS TO R&R DUE BY 10/30/2008. SIGNED BY HONORABLE JAMES T. GILES ON 10/9/08. (Attachments: # (1) order) 10/9/08 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED TO ALL PARTIES, E-MAILED TO COUNSEL.(pr, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:08-cv-03180; COLON v. ROZUM et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of Pennsylvania
extension.docketText: MAGISTRATE THOMAS J. RUETER'S REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION THAT THE PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS BE DISMISSED AS TIME-BARRED AND THAT NO CERTIFICATE OF APPEALABILITY BE GRANTED. THE PETITIONER MAY FILE OBJECTIONS TO THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION. OBJECTIONS TO R&R DUE BY 10/30/2008. SIGNED BY HONORABLE JAMES T. GILES ON 10/9/08. (Attachments: # (1) order) 10/9/08 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED TO ALL PARTIES, E-MAILED TO COUNSEL.(pr, )

titleInfo.title: COLON v. ROZUM et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER THAT THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION OF MAGISTRATE JUDGE THOMAS J. RUETER IS APPROVED AND ADOPTED; THE PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS IS DENIED WITH PREJUDICE AND DISMISSED WITHOUT AN EVIDENTIARY HEARING; PETITIONER'S PETITION TO AMEND IS DENIED AS MOOT; THERE IS NO PROBABLE CAUSE TO ISSUE A CERT. OF APPEALABILITY AND THE CLERK SHALL CLOSE THIS CASE.. SIGNED BY HONORABLE MICHAEL M. BAYLSON ON 1/28/09. 2/2/09 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED TO ALL PARTIES, E-MAILED TO COUNSEL.(pr, ) Modified on 2/2/2009 (pr, ).
